posts.cooked:
Hi, my team is trying to power the new Jetson Orin Nano (different from Jetson Nano). I went through other forums, like the one below, but it seems the Jetson Nano is limited to 5 Watts.

https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/powering-a-jetson-nano/375228

However, after looking for the power requirements for the new Orin nano, I found a forum stating that it could handle between 5 and 20 volts. ( NVIDIA Forum ) Is it possible to directly wire the barrel jack to the PDP ? If so, which AMP fuse is best?

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

link_counts.title: Battery Power for Jetson Orin Nano - Jetson Orin Nano - NVIDIA Developer Forums

posts.name: Dan Langdon
posts.cooked: I would say the voltage drop you will see while running other motors would be a big issue without some voltage regulation.  We were just having a discussion on our team about 4 piâ€™s with cameras or moving to a Jetson.  Power has come up a few times.

posts.name: Justus
posts.cooked:
We currently run this 16v one . We have also used 19v version w/ no problem.

Cut off the car port and connect to 10A or 20A breaker on PDH .

posts.name: RyanShoff
posts.cooked: We powered one off a CTRE VRM 2A 12V port all of CIR last weekend with 90% gpu utilization.

posts.name: Geoffrey
posts.cooked: Awesome!!! Is there any difference between these two? Will the performance be affected by the power supply?

posts.name: Justus
posts.cooked: Theres probably a negligible difference. We had no problem running pretty fast ml pipeline on the 16v.

posts.name: Nathan Zhou
posts.cooked:
One thing I want to mention is the size of barrel jack plug youâ€™re using it.  The spec says its

5.5mm OD / 2.1mm ID / 9.5mm length

So if you got a random barrel jack plug that feels like itâ€™s fit and your Jetson do power on, it MIGHT NOT be the correct one. Using a wrong barrel jack plug could cause your Jetson drop power under high vibration.

Also an alternative to buck converter to power Jetson is to use a USB power bank that support 15W out. This power bank provide constant power to Jetson and is not powered by robot battery at all. However if youâ€™re doing this, I do suggest have an extra (or many extra) power bank on hand and have a dedicated charger in pit for this power bank. And I would check the remaining juice on that power bank between every match. I would also add a power switch for Jetson to reboot it just in case.
